snippet: Awonder Liang of Wisconsin won first place in the under-10 open division, and four other Americans either won medals or came close.
abstract: Dylan Loeb McClain Chess column notes wins by Awonder Liang and other participants in the United States' scholastic chess programs at the World Youth Chess Championships in the United Arab Emirates.
lead_paragraph: Awonder Liang of Wisconsin won first place in the under-10 open division, and four other Americans either won medals or came close.

headline.main: Strong Showing for U.S. at Youth Championships
headline.print_headline: Strong Showing for U.S. At Youth Championships
